se.hig.exte.restcontroller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.hig.exte.restcontroller.UserController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/api/users")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a RestController class responsible for mapping HTTP requests under the /users path. It contains mappings of end-points to CrudServices that operate on User records in the database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserController(UserService userService)
      Creates an UserController object.

    • Method Detail

      • saveUser

        @PostMapping(value="/")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> saveUser(@RequestBody
                                                                                       User user)
        Creates a User and stores it in the database.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to add in the form of a JSON-object in the POST request.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing the saved User and an HTTP status code.

      • getUser

        @GetMapping(value="/{id}")
public User getUser(@PathVariable
                                                java.lang.String id)
        Fetches the User object with the given ID from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the User to fetch.
        Returns:
        The User with the given ID.

      • getAllCourses

        @GetMapping(value="/all")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<User>> getAllCourses()
        Fetches all User records from the database and returns them as a ResponseEntity object. List of User objects is automatically converted to JSON using Spring Boot's HttpMessageConverter and put in the ResponseEntity's body.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing the fetched User objects.

      • updateUser

        @PatchMapping(value="/")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> updateUser(@RequestBody
                                                                                          User user)
        Updates the User object with the given ID in the database.
        Parameters:
        user - The User to update in the form of a JSON-object in the POST request.
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity object containing the updated User and an HTTP status code.

      • deleteUserById

        @DeleteMapping(value="/{id}")
public void deleteUserById(@PathVariable
                                                          int id)
        Deletes the User object with the given ID from the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the User to delete.
